Package com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements.tables

Class Table

java.lang.Object
com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements.PageElement
com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements.tables.Table
Direct Known Subclasses:
NGXDataTable
public class Table
extends PageElement
Implements a Table WebElement. contains functionality for counting values, finding values inside a table, and other management issues, such as finding a value in the same row.

  • Constructor Details

    • Table

      public Table​(java.lang.String elementName, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> selectors)
      Creates a table object to manipulate. When used the table object finds and creates rows and columns and stores them. If data in the table changes you must use the reset() method. You can save the current state of a table by calling the storeTable() method.
      Parameters:
      elementName - String the name of the element
      selectors - Map<String,String> the list of selectors to use to find the element

  • Method Details

    • reset

      protected void reset()
      Resets table data when comparing multiple pages of the same table.

    • getOrCreateHeaders

      protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOrCreateHeaders()
      Returns the headers in the table as a list of Strings, populates with the first row if there are no <th> tags. Creates headers if they do not already exist.
      Returns:
      List<String> the headers of the table, populates with the first row if there are no <th> tags

    • getOrCreateHeaderElements

      protected java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> getOrCreateHeaderElements()
      Returns the header elements in the table as a list of WebElements, creates row elements if no <th$gt; elements are found, and logs the number of Header Elements
      Returns:
      List<WebElement> the headers

    • getHeaderElements

      protected java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> getHeaderElements()
      Returns all header elements. Internal method, intended to be called by getOrCreateHeaderElements().
      Returns:
      List<WebElement> the headers; or null if the header tags are not found

    • tableHeadersExist

      protected boolean tableHeadersExist()
      Returns true if the table has <th> elements, otherwise returns false even though the first row will be used to populate the headers list.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the table has <th> elements, otherwise false
      See Also:
      getOrCreateHeaderElements()

    • getOrCreateRowElements

      protected java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> getOrCreateRowElements()
      Returns <tr> elements found in a table.
      Returns:
      List<WebElement>

    • getOrCreateRows

      protected java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getOrCreateRows()
      Returns array of cell arrays, with data for each cell, in the table. Initial row of table headers is removed
      Returns:
      List<ArrayList<String>>

    • getNumberOfRows

      public int getNumberOfRows()
      Returns number of row elements from getOrCreateRowElements
      Returns:
      int the number of row elements
      See Also:
      getOrCreateRowElements()

    • getOrCreateColumns

      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getOrCreateColumns()
      Returns the mapping of header strings to cell arrays for each column in the table. e.g. { "Date Column": ["1/1/01", "1/2/01", ...] }
      Returns:
      Map<String, ArrayList<String>>

    • getNumberOfColumns

      public int getNumberOfColumns()
      Returns the number of columns in the table.
      Returns:
      int the number of columns
      See Also:
      getOrCreateHeaders()

    • getCells

      protected java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> getCells​(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement tableRow)
      Returns list of all cells in the given tableRow, and logs the first cell and then row cells in separate log entries.
      Parameters:
      tableRow - WebElement a row in the table
      Returns:
      List<WebElement;>

    • storeTable

      public void storeTable​(int pageNumber)
      Stores the current table rows on the current page in an index given by the integer passed in the pageNumber parameter. Used for comparing paginated table data.
      Parameters:
      pageNumber - int the page number under which to store the table data for comparison

    • storeTable

      public void storeTable()
      Stores the current tables rows in index 1. Used for single-page (un-paginated) tables.

    • compareWithStoredTable

      public boolean compareWithStoredTable​(int pageNumber)
      Compares the given number of a page stored in memory and compares it to the one currently being displayed. If all the rows match, returns true. If any data is different, returns false.
      Parameters:
      pageNumber - int the stored page number to compare against the current page
      Returns:
      boolean Table matches the one in memory.

    • getElementInRowThatContains

      public org.openqa.selenium.WebElement getElementInRowThatContains​(java.lang.String rowLocatorText, java.lang.String elementLocatorText)
      Returns a WebElement found inside the indicated row, taking unique text to find the row and unique text to find a specific element in that row.
      Parameters:
      elementLocatorText - String the text of the element (link) you are looking to find
      rowLocatorText - String the unique text to locate the row to search
      Returns:
      org.openqa.selenium.WebElement the first element inside the table that was found using the given locator

    • getElementInRowThatContains

      public org.openqa.selenium.WebElement getElementInRowThatContains​(int ordinalRow, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Returns a WebElement found inside the indicated row using the locator passed. TODO: Fix this so that it uses PageElements
      Parameters:
      ordinalRow - int takes -1 , 1...n where -1 signifies the last row
      elementLocator - org.openqa.selenium.By the locator to use to find the element
      Returns:
      org.openqa.selenium.WebElement the first element inside the table that was found using the given locator

    • getElementInRowThatContains

      public org.openqa.selenium.WebElement getElementInRowThatContains​(org.openqa.selenium.By rowLocator, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Returns a WebElement found inside the indicated row, taking a locator to find the row and a locator to find a specific element in that row.
      Parameters:
      rowLocator - org.openqa.selenium.By the locator to use to find the row to search
      elementLocator - org.openqa.selenium.By the locator to use to find the element
      Returns:
      org.openqa.selenium.WebElement the first element inside the table that was found using the given locator

    • clickElementInRowThatContains

      public void clickElementInRowThatContains​(java.lang.String elementText, java.lang.String textToClick)
      Clicks a link in a row by using text in another cell. For example, finding an "Edit" link for a specific username in a table. To work, this method must have a link name and a unique string to match. This method could also be used to validate text in a cell in the same row Returning successfully would indicate the expected text was found.
      Parameters:
      elementText - String the text of the element (link) you are looking to find
      textToClick - String the unique text to locate the row in question

    • clickElementInRowThatContains

      public void clickElementInRowThatContains​(org.openqa.selenium.By rowLocator, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Clicks on an element found by elementLocator, in a row found by rowLocator.
      Parameters:
      rowLocator - org.openqa.selenium.By the locator to use to find the row to search
      elementLocator - org.openqa.selenium.By the locator to use to find the element

    • clickElementInRowThatContains

      public void clickElementInRowThatContains​(int ordinalRow, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Clicks on an element found by elementLocator, in a row found by ordinalRow.
      Parameters:
      ordinalRow - int takes -1 , 1...n where -1 signifies the last row
      elementLocator - org.openqa.selenium.By the locator to use to find the element

    • verifyAllColumnCellsContain

      public boolean verifyAllColumnCellsContain​(java.lang.String columnHeader, java.lang.String textToMatch)
      Returns true if all cells in the given column match the text value given.
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String the name of the column
      textToMatch - String the text that should be in every cell
      Returns:
      boolean true if the column contains the given text in every cell, false if not

    • verifyAnyColumnCellContains

      public boolean verifyAnyColumnCellContains​(java.lang.String columnHeader, java.lang.String textToMatch)
      Returns true if any cells in the given column match the text value given.
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String the name of the column
      textToMatch - String the text that should be in at least one of the cells
      Returns:
      boolean true if the column contains the given text in at least one of the cells, false if not

    • verifyColumnCellsAreSortedAscending

      public boolean verifyColumnCellsAreSortedAscending​(java.lang.String columnName)
      Checks all the cells in a given column and verifies they are sorted in ascending order.
      Parameters:
      columnName - String the name of the column you want to evaluate
      Returns:
      boolean true is the column is sorted in ascending order, false if it is not sorted correctly

    • verifyColumnCellsAreSortedDescending

      public boolean verifyColumnCellsAreSortedDescending​(java.lang.String columnName)
      Checks all the cells in a given column and verifies they are sorted in ascending order.
      Parameters:
      columnName - String the name of the column you want to evaluate
      Returns:
      boolean true is the column is sorted in descending order, false if it is not sorted correctly

    • verifyColumnCellsAreSorted

      public boolean verifyColumnCellsAreSorted​(java.lang.String columnName, boolean sortOrderAscending)
      Checks all the cells in a given column and verifies they are sorted in requested Comparator order.

      NOTE: Use the verifyColumnCellsAreSortedAscending() and verifyColumnCellsAreSortedDescending() methods unless you have a custom sort to pass. Passing the wrong value can cause errors.

      Parameters:
      columnName - String the name of the column you want to evaluate
      sortOrderAscending - boolean true for ascending, false for descending
      Returns:
      boolean true is the column is sorted in the passed sort order, false if it is not sorted correctly

    • verifyColumnCellsAreUnique

      public boolean verifyColumnCellsAreUnique​(java.lang.String columnHeader)
      Returns <code>true</code> if the column cells are unique
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String text of the given column header to search
      Returns:
      boolean true if column cells are unique, false if duplicates are found, throws error otherwise

    • verifyColumnExists

      public boolean verifyColumnExists​(java.lang.String columnName)
      Returns true if column exists, false if column does not exist
      Parameters:
      columnName - String name of column to find
      Returns:
      boolean true if column exists, false if column does not exists.

    • verifyRowCellsAreUnique

      public boolean verifyRowCellsAreUnique​(java.lang.String columnName)
      Returns true if the row cell's values are unique for the given column name
      Parameters:
      columnName - String comma delimited columns list
      Returns:
      boolean true if all cells values are unique, false if any duplicates

    • verifyRowCellsAreUnique

      public boolean verifyRowCellsAreUnique​(java.lang.String[] columnHeaders)
      Returns true if the cell values are unique for the given array of column names
      Parameters:
      columnHeaders - string[] the array of column name to validate
      Returns:
      boolean true if all cells values are unique, false if any duplicates

    • getCellsValue

      private java.lang.String getCellsValue​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> indexes, java.util.List<java.lang.String> cells)
      Returns all the cells values in the listed columns
      Parameters:
      indexes - List<Integer> listed column index
      cells - List<String> row cells
      Returns:
      String of listed columns row values
